review_blob: Lovely malty, coffee aroma with a hint of whiskey or something else stronger! Dark but with a reddish hue and clear. More body and depth on the stout side of this BIPA but still very well balanced with a medium body and a oily texture. Not your usual English BIPA which sets it out from the crowd.

The aroma has a heavy brandy and mulled apple nose - very Christmasy but without being sickly. A rich slightly cloudy cider appearance of golden/amber. Taste is a rich balanced sour saison with sweet notes. Clean and fresh with a slight creamy and very long finish. No or very little carbonation. Try it before it goes!

The best thing about this beer is its aroma - nicely balanced with tones of spruce and pine underpinned by a slight malty background. The appearance is a hazy golden amber beer with minimal head. It has a bitter but balanced taste with a light body. The finish could be longer but a good all round amber ale.
beer_name: Wiper and True Amber Ale In The Pines

review_blob: Bottled from Sourced. Mellow coffee and chocolate aroma, no head and dark for a porter. Bitter and medium body and oily in texture and sadly to short a finish but otherwise a good porter. Looking forward to tasting it direct from a keg...

From Sourced in a bottle... Lovely mellow aroma woody with a hint of malt coming through. Hazy amber in colour and packed full of hops to taste. Light to medium body with a soft carbonation. Good finish and overall a great example of Red Rye.
beer_name: Five Points Trial Brew Red Rye Chinook Columbus Simcoe
